comments.text: I prefer to stand just before the bus station so you're not hitching with all the locals. Sign for Romania got me picked up to a better spot on the road to the border within 15 minutes.
South BUS, not TRAIN Station :)
Great spot.  Pretty much everything going South.  Got a ride to the border in minutes.
Exactly after the South Train Station., after a gas station

We went to the queue and asked people for a ride just across border, as you need a vehicle to cross.
We got a ride to Iashi.
go to Romania
direction Cahul and Giurgiulești (Romanian border)
direction Cimislia, Comrat
Great spot, got a ride across the border to Romania within 20 minutes from here, from a guy who could've taken me all the way to Antwerp (Belgium).

Along the main road to Romania. Not sure how to get here by public transport from Chisinau, I got dropped off here by someone who would take me to the correct road to Romania. A lot of space to stop for cars, got a ride across the border within 20 minutes from here, from a guy who could've taken me all the way to Antwerp (Belgium).

Got a lift to the border with help from the police and there was three of us guys. [Blog Post about journey to Odessa through Tiraspol](http://www.hobospirit.com/hitchhiking-from-chisinau-to-odessa-via-tiraspol-transnistria/)
After the police post control, before the club,  a little bit after the sign with Tiraspol name, you have shadow. 15 min.
If you want to go to the border Moldavia/Romania
10 min. from here to the end of tiraspol.
going to Capriana
go to Chisinau
Took me some time because I had a sign saying Comrat but eventually I got a ride all the way to the Romanian border at Giurgiulești.

Hitchhiked right after the Moldovan side of the border crossing which the guards didn’t have any issue with. I had a sign saying Comrat, eventually I was taken to Căușeni. I recommend using a sign saying Căușeni or just thumbing, as cars don’t really stop unless going all the way to your destination.
Got onto the second car with 2 friends. Fair spot, a bit of walking from the centre of course.
Nice 50km/h zone and can get there easily by a bus.

Hitchhiking to Chisinau, Moldova.
Lots of space for cars to stop. They see you from afar but are going pretty fast. Got a short ride here but they came back and too me to Chisinau. And of course have a sign to 'Chisinau'
Super friendly family gave us a ride to the capital, 2 of us.
Chisinau-Tiraspol.. We got a ride to the border even if the guy lived before it
Stood with a sign saying Tiraspol in Cyrillic (Тирасполь), a guy took me to Bender and then I took the trolley to Tiraspol for 4 PMR rubles (less than 25 euro cents)
As of 2014 the trolley station is called Gradina Botanica and it is the final station of trolley 22.

To Odessa, Bender, Tiraspol, Causeni. You can get here using a bus Nr.122, trolley Nr.22, 18 . Bus stop PORTILE ORASULUI. A lot of cars, but almoust no trucks, because for them tranzit through Chisinau is not existing anymore.

Gas station, Chisinau->Ungheni.
Waiting time <5min.
great for asking people at station
(two male students)
Some 100meters from school, under the shade of trees, road is wide, people are nice. We hichhiked in two pairs of men, got a ride in under 30minutes to Chisinau.

It's furthest you can get with city marshrutkas. Not too much space to stop but place is visible. Got ride to Chisinau in 20 mins. Keep in mind that many people want to pay so make it clear before getting in car.

To Orhei Village
Waiting Time: 3min.

To get in here, take minibus 190 from city.
A supermarket is near here, you can buy sketchbook and marker pen.

オルヘイ村へ。
マルシュルートカ190番で市内からここに来られます。もしかしたらもっと先までいけるかもしれません。
スーパーが近くにあります。
オルヘイ修道院に行きたい場合は途中のジャンクションまで乗せてもらいそこから乗り換えましょう、僕は間違えて村まで行ってしまいました。
Got a lift to Tiraspol and there was three of us guys. [Blog Post about journey to Odessa through Tiraspol](http://www.hobospirit.com/hitchhiking-from-chisinau-to-odessa-via-tiraspol-transnistria/)
Good place near airport with plenty of room for cars to pull in. Odessa or Tiraspol.
It was evening and gipsies were starting to gather. A guy stopped, asked money, we explained we have no money and that we don't pay. He said nothing and we went to Slobozia Mare.
In front of the bus station. No public service to Giurgiulesti.
Waited 10 mins and then stopped a direct bus to Comrat.
To get here, ask for marshrutka from Bendery/Tighina centre (to there, you get by trolleybus from Tiraspol) and get off at Dispečerskaja. Walk 100 m to the border crossing.
You can ask people waiting at the border crossing or just wait at the exit. Most people stop, most want money.
In 15 min. Across the road you have a petrol station
just after the roundabout theres plenty of space - perfect for getting towards ukraine
for heading to the northern part of transnistria its the best in tiraspol
A lot of place for the cars stoping. Use a sign, and avoid a mini buses. Here is many officials and unofficials minibuses who always stoping to take You to Your destination,and asking for a money.

Towards Tiraspol. You can ask drivers in the waiting line for Tranistrian passport control (that is what I did and got a ride in no time). After the border itself (50m) there is a place for the to stop as well so you can stay with the sign. But better to ask on the border.
To Soroca, Orhei. You can get here using a bus Nr.37; 47; 48 from the city center & minibus Nr.130  . Bus stop Cricova.
Good hitchhiking spot at the entrance of the petrol station towards Glodeni
if you don't want to cross transnistria toward Odessa hitchike here and you can easily find a car. probbaly they ask some money
got ride just through border with very nice couple

Perfect spot when you are going to Chisinau. There is a place for cars to stop here. 

If you are not lucky, there are many mini buses that will always stop if you show your thumb
Possible to Odesa. :) Use bus number 2 to next to here ;)
You can’t cross the border on foot but the guard was chill with me hitchhiking right before his post, even suggested I do so
Two guys took us to Galati. 1h 30 mins waiting at the border.
Direction RO. The border crossing is for cars only. You can ask drivers that wait for it.
there are few cars.

Border-crossing with very low traffic. The border police might be bored and entertain you with questions, and eventually they will let you pass through without trouble. They might appreciate a little bribe, and they will let you know. If you give them the equivalent of one Euro, they will be happy with it.

You can cross on foot.
It was night but we were extremely lucky.
Direction RO.
There are very few cars there but they usually go far distances as there are not many cities on the way (or at all). I got a ride close to Ukrainian border after 10 mins.
To Balti, Edinet, Briceni, Cenauti. You can get here using a bus Nr.37; 47; 48 from the city center & minibus Nr.130  . Bus stop Cricova.
direction: Odessa, If you find your bus ride from Tiraspol leaves you at the border (which is comman if your western) you can get a ride anyware along the road
Most people didn't stop but fortunately one guy took me further into direction of transnistria
No regular cars took us but after 20 min a bus going to Chisinau stopped and took us there for ~10€ per person. Not hitchhiking per se but practical.
ok spot, many cars staying in town but we got a ride to border after some time
bad spot, cars going fast and not space for them to stop, in sometime we got ride to better place
Nobody stopped, was trying to go to Tiraspol
To avoid. Barely any cars passing. Probably better than the Larga crossing still according to some locals
